channel.title: Post Cool Sounds Made With Reverb, Tone, etc
channel.description: So, I just released a new song (https://soundcloud.com/sanabajaj/liftoff), and a lot of the sounds (Gossip, Runner, even Sweeper) I noticed sounded way better when I added some reverb to it, or changed the tone. Do you guys have any tips and tricks about sound editing you want to share? Post 'em here! :smiley:

item.title: Post Cool Sounds Made With Reverb, Tone, etc
item.dc:creator: crystldawnmusic
item.description:
Try Bo one octave lower than June, both with like 1/10 lowpass.

(cough, @GOD, cough)

Read full topic
item.source: Post Cool Sounds Made With Reverb, Tone, etc

item.title: Post Cool Sounds Made With Reverb, Tone, etc
item.dc:creator: anon6476606
item.description:

item.description:
Just found a cool new one:
Tiny at the lowest octave with pitch all the way down tone 5/6 up and shape all the way up creates cool electronic bell sound.

item.title: Post Cool Sounds Made With Reverb, Tone, etc
item.dc:creator: AzureOnyx
item.description:
I mentioned before in the forum that you can use Silk as strings by increasing the Shape knob at the 9:00 position, and decreasing the Lowpass knob to the 3:00 position.

Glow, which is in AP-001, can be used as an acoustic guitar. Use the Pitch Modulation and increase it to the max.

What other possibilities can you guys create to recreate an instrument?

https://app.auxy.co/projects/1HyHRe3bDQ5MFYC9jW7DiA==

Read full topic
item.source: Post Cool Sounds Made With Reverb, Tone, etc

item.title: Post Cool Sounds Made With Reverb, Tone, etc

item.description:
lobby with full reverb and tone, and a lowpass automation on every single sixteenth note going from down to up. makes for a really cool pad. if you want an example or a screenshot, hit me up
